content.description: Located left (east) of 29 Bombs (5.11a) on a smooth section of slab just left of a left-facing corner. After a distinct crux down low the difficulties ease and provide an enjoyable exercise in slab climbing. Gear belay and walk off to the climber's left. One star out of five.
This climb goes up a cool looking pointed spire right of the Group Camp #1 Wall. The climb faces North.
content.protection: One FP, and 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right of Group Camp #1 Wall on a separate formation. Faces the road.

content.description:
Get off the ground by pulling on grainy jugs and sidepulls to the first bolt. From there, get into the left-to-right up-angling crack. Good holds for your hands, although the feet disappear a bit as you work up and right. After the 5th bolt, you encounter a seam that goes much more vertically: pull up into that, clip one more bolt, and then finish on easy slab to the top.

Kind of an awkward start, so would recommend a stick-clip for the first bolt. Second person has to clean on TR.
content.protection: 6 bolts to bolted anchor. Recommend cleaning on toprope due to traversing nature of the climb.
content.location: Up in the boulders behind group campsite 4. The crack is clearly visible from the road. Maybe a 5 minute scramble up to the gully where the route starts.

content.description: This route goes up the west face of a dark brown boulder past 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Park in Group Campsite Three area. Walk straight forward from car (south) about 100 yards looking left and you will see the formation.

content.description:
5 Bolts to two anchors left of

29 Bombs

(11a). Anchor bolts are missing. The rock quality through, and above the crux, is marginal at best. The movement however is fairly fun.

Decent, well protected climb.  The landing area if you come off before the 1st bolt is a sloping rock, so you might want to make sure your belayer is spotting you until you get that first clip in.  Sharp rock with the good movement throughout.  Once you get the 1st bolt, all the hard moves are well protected.  If you want to jam the crack at the top, you might want to tape up.
content.location: Sport bolted route on the western edge of Group Campsite #2 by the road.  This route is not grouped with the other Campsite 2 climbs up and behind the area.

content.description:
This is a fun, well-bolted sport climb on a north-facing (i.e., shady) wall.

Start up right-angling finger crack, then work out onto steep, featured face past 3 bolts.

Rap from bolts atop the route.
content.protection: 3 bolts, a couple of 1.5" pieces, bolted anchor/rap
